comment: Test questions often did not match the course material, which was a bit frustrating. Hopefully they fix that for future semesters. The professor gave 100s on everything manually graded, so it helped to offset the grade drop due to exams. Otherwise, class was chill. Assignments due every 2 wks, and more than adequate time given for research paper.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Wolde is a pretty solid choice for Security Admin. You usually have two weeks to submit an assignment. The subject material is a bit outdated (but that's more so a KSU problem). He's a fair grader, but not the most responsive to emails.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: The resources needed for this course being clearly presented and available online was extremely helpful. Professor Wolde was also always available for virtual office hours and answered any of my questions in a timely manner. I would recommend taking this course!

The worst class I have taken at KSU. Most modules were links to outside sources - many of which 404'd. Prof could have checked content for errors before posting but couldn't be bothered to do the minimum. Quizzes and tests often had questions over material never covered. Disappointing. Issue is likely course specific, so pick another if you can.
